Speaker: sonny liston
Dialogue: Gonna fuck you up. Gonna beat you like I's your daddy...

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: TIME!

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: TIME!!!

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Sonny Liston: you ain't no champ! You a chump!  You want to lose your money, bet on Sonny. He know I'm great. He will go in eight!

Speaker: a man
Dialogue: ...210... Cassius Clay weighs 210 pounds.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: You sure you got that right...?

Speaker: the man
Dialogue: 218. Sonny Liston...the heavyweight champion of the world weighs 218 pounds...

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Pounds of what?!

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Pounds of ugly! He so ugly, sweat run backwards off his forehead to get away from his face! C'mon, bear! I turn you into a rug!! Rumble right now, man!

Speaker: sonny liston
Dialogue: Keep talkin', punk-ass faggot! I'll fuck you up like I's your daddy...

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: You whup me, I'll crawl out of the ring on my knees and catch the next jet plane out of the country.

Speaker: jimmy cannon
Dialogue: That a promise?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: ...you be the first eatin' his words!

Speaker: the doctor
Dialogue: 210 over 110?! I can't let him in the ring in this condition!

Speaker: reporters
Dialogue: ...odds 7:1 against you. Big bet's whether he'll knock you out in the first round or third round or kill you altogether. You scared of him?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: I'm scared of no man. I give Sonny Liston talking lessons, boxing lessons and falling down lessons.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: "Black Muslim"'s a press word...

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Man's religion's his own business. What kinda question's that?

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Howard!

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: ...cannot stand you, Cassius.   He really wants to kill you...

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Howard Cosell, you are an instigator!  How you get that way? When I'm done with Liston, I'm comin' for you!

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: It doesn't come down, I cancel this fight. You call me in an hour with his blood pressure.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: I'm called Bundini, rhymes with Houdini. He was a Jew, too...some other people call me Fastblack...or Daddy Mac...

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Who Shorty?

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: I call him Shorty 'cause he like 'em circumcised. Original people. Like Moses. And I was a babe in a basket, too. I was born on a doorstep with a note 'cross my chest that read, "Do the best you can for him, world." I had to suck the first nipple come along. I didn't run away from home...I been runnin' to home.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: ...I study every fight. 'Til I got a plan. Wear him down two through four. Drop him in the fifth round. So the p'diction ain't a p'diction. It's a plan. And 'cause of all the poppin' off I do, I know I gotta win! That's the truth. And why I'm tellin' you?

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: 'Cause I'm gonna be your Inspiration. Your motivator. In your corner. Can I be in your corner, young man?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Ain't spent much time in Miami. Where the water?

Speaker: pacheco
Dialogue: 120 over 80?  You should be asleep...

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: When you get back?

Speaker: rudy
Dialogue: I'm gonna find Mom and Dad.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: You could have stayed. Nobody gotta hide when they with me.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: He's right.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: He was supposed to kill me.   Well, I'm still alive.

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: He's opened a cut on Liston. Liston's never been cut!

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: He's nothin' to me...

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: ...my eyes!

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: My eyes! I can't see...somethin' in my eyes!

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Cut 'em off! Cut 'em!   I'm blind.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: No. You quit, it's over! Get out there. Be a yardstick. This is the big one, daddy. Get out there and run!

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: ...Clay, a round ago, looked like he'd about had it, but in round six...

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: I upset the world! I am the greatest! I am the greatest!

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: What made him so easy for you?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: I told you. Didn't I tell you?

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Was there any single point you knew you had him?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: I had him in the first round. 'Cause I'm the greatest!  Sam... Hey, Sam! Let him up.

Speaker: gordon davidson
Dialogue: ...I don't care what should have been ordered! We need a victory party right now.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Why's he so scared?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: The Mummy! "I can't get away from the mummy!" Yeah, but that mummy too slow to catch anybody.

Speaker: sam cooke
Dialogue: Hey!   The mummy always gets his man...

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: No, he don't!  Now, don't believe that stuff on television...

Speaker: a reporter
Dialogue: The people look to you. Do you plan on being a people's champ, like Joe Louis?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: But not like Joe Louis, exactly...

Speaker: a reporter
Dialogue: Mr. Clay...?

Speaker: reporters
Dialogue: You a card-carrying member?    Aren't Black Muslims a hate group?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: "Card-carrying"...? Don't need no "card." You got a Christian card? 750 million people believe in Islam. I'm one of them.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: I'm going to be a people's champion. But I don't have to be the way you want me to be. I'm gonna be what I want. And I'm free to think any way I want...

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: ...watchin' a show on termites...they knockin' down this house, here.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Six million in your house and you don't know it. Where?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Africa? No. Only Rome.      Yeah, man, let's go!

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: When we leaving?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Tore out a picture of Emmett Till when I was little. Couldn't take my eyes to it...couldn't look at it. Barb-wire around his neck to a 75- pound cotton-gin fan. Took out his eye. The cruelty to it...I couldn't look at it...couldn't throw it away.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: I thought, "What I do wrong to be so low that people could do that to people like me?" It made me feel ashamed. And that makes no sense. But that's what it was.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: You can fix that...

Speaker: elijah muhammad
Dialogue: Only after long service and high merit in the spiritual and physical rebirth of Afro-American people...is one granted an original name. But you are special. A world champion. So there is a gift I wish to give you. From this day forward you will be known as Muhammad Ali...which means "one worthy of praise," and Ali means "most high."

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: "Worthy of praise..." Thank you!

Speaker: elijah muhammad
Dialogue: Be very careful what you say...your words reflect on the nation of Islam, now.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: elijah muhammad
Dialogue: I do not feel this is a wise course anymore.

Speaker: cassius
Dialogue: This is a great honor, Messenger...

Speaker: a neighbor
Dialogue: One more.  Thank you.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: When the contract run out. I want black lawyers and managers. Chauncey Eskridge on North La Salle Street...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I don't need no "protectin'" from myself. Why I need protecting from myself by them...?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I ain't one of their thoroughbreds! Or their charity things. "Let's do somethin' for that well-behaved colored boy, Cassius." I ain't well-behaved nothing! I am a man.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: No one "made me"...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: No one's in that ring but me!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I know who I'm not...I'm not drinkin'! Goin' back on my wife! I am not prayin' to no blue-eyed, blonde-haired Jesus. I ain't...

Speaker: odessa clay
Dialogue: You didn't get it from me...your words, your sense of humor, what makes you angry, what makes you a fighter. You got that from your daddy...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You saying I'm just like him?

Speaker: odessa clay
Dialogue: I'm saying, if he was your age today, he'd do the same as you. And he knows that.

Speaker: betty shabazz
Dialogue: Malcolm?

Speaker: betty shabazz
Dialogue: Go anyway. Don't put it off.      It's not safe here. ONE OF HIS CHILDREN  Mommy...the bath's ready...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Hey, man, where they put the real pilot? What you doin' up here?

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Here, Mr. Clay, sit down...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: No, man, I meant...in L'ville, when I growed up, they barely let black folks drive buses.

Speaker: the pilot
Dialogue: Here we are. Cote d'Ivoire...Africa.

Speaker: marlin thomas
Dialogue: Anything?

Speaker: the man
Dialogue: ...on the phone with his wife. She's having a hard time sleeping...baby's kicking a lot...

Speaker: marlin thomas
Dialogue: Motor Pool, here, have a Chevy parts catalogue...?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Hey, man!!!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: We just got here now...  And, maaan, the brothers were flyin' a DC 8. Flippin' switches, navigatin', filing flight plans, talkin' French...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Man, where should I go?   We're planning on Egypt.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Un moment...

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Il n'y a pas de quoi. Cela m'a fait grand plaisir. Faites-lui mes compliments.

Speaker: marlin thomas
Dialogue: Malcolm bumped into Cassius Clay. Muhammad Ali...whatever he calls himself...

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: I thought that was all over. Is Clay going to support Malcolm's U.N. resolution?

Speaker: marlin thomas
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Find out. We'll pick up on Malcolm in Liberia ourselves.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...shouldn't have quarreled with the Honorable Elijah...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You shouldn't have quarreled with Elijah Muhammad.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Sonji...Sonji Roi...

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: What you keep sayin' my name for?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: 'Cause I love it, girl. How long you been workin' for Herbert?

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: 'Bout a year. I sell "Muhammad Speaks" over the phone...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What kind of name is that?

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: My father named me after Sonja Henie.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What's your father do?

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: He was shot in a poker game when I was two. He don't do nothin'. Sonja, on the other hand, was an ice skater, and my mother died when I was eleven.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: So who raised you?

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Godparents, but I been on my own, doing my own thing...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Whatcha doin' tomorrow?       Go ridin' with me.

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: No.   I gotta work, you know.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I square it with Herbert.       I got a record player in my car.

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: A record player?     C'mon.    How come it don't skip?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Got springs and stuff.

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Herbert said you met The Beatles.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yeah. Only one of 'em's smart...the one with the glasses.

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: ...he's my favorite.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: People all screaming and fainting. I asked him, "This the way they act when you get big?"

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: What he say?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: He said, "Champ. The more real you get, the more unreal it gonna get."

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Wow...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Let's go...

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Where you live?

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: I'm takin' you there...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I think I gonna keep you around forever, girl.

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Well, I'm not too busy right now, so...I'll think on it.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Herbert said you weren't a Muslim.

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Cover my hair? No make-up?     Long dresses? Honey, please.  Were you a virgin?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: 'Cause you so "gone" off a little good time.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I'm no virgin...but I may as well be.  I ain't jokin'! I always know when I know. See this face? I mean, you got a pretty face for a girl's face, but you ever seen somethin' as pretty as me? Now, you about five-foot-three...that's too small. But I overlook that, too, 'cause...

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Thank you so much.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...'cause of your spirit!

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: My "spirit"...?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yeah.   'Cause you too much fun!

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: You serious?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: But you gotta be a Muslim.

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Huh? How you do that? Step over a broom...shazaam...you a Muslim?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Maaan, I ain't never been with a girl like you.

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Baby, maybe you ain't ever gonna be with any other.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: That's right.   I wanna marry her.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: You can't marry that girl! She was a date! Have some fun! She's not your wife! You don't marry this girl.  Sign there. Management papers. My father will kill me.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: True love!

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: Watch what you signing, Ali.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Nothing to do with you.

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: You talkin' to me, or someone walk inna room, fat boy? Anything's do to with me I think's to d-d-do with me...I'm st-st-still a Christian.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: And get me a kosher cook...lady who cooks at Malcolm's temple. Put my brother on the payroll. 50g a year for drivin' and jivin'.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Lana Shabazz...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yeah. How 'bout it, Howard. You be my official full-time photographer.

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: I ain't goin' on your payroll. I like it freelance. Emphasis on "free."

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Muhammad. She's not...for you. When I met her, she was working at a cocktail lounge with a bunny tail on her backside.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: What were you doin' down at a cocktail lounge, Herbert? Sellin' "Muhammad Peeks"?

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Sober up and say something to this man, Bundini. You supposed to be his "inspiration."

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: You been s-s-saving it up, training, Champ. You can't unleash it on this girl all sudden. You may kill her! Maybe you should spread it around more before you tie it down.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: No. Marriage is the cornerstone of Muslim life.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Sonji Roi is not a Muslim!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: She gonna be a Muslim, now!  So fix it up, Herbert.

Speaker: joe smiley
Dialogue: The idea was...to...make...Malcolm smaller, you know? Diminished; obscure? Not to turn him into a messiah.

Speaker: joe smiley
Dialogue: Thyroid. I got a stab wound in 1961. They took it out. We gotta talk about this guy, too.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What you drinkin'?

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: What am I drinkin'? Water's what I'm drinkin', champ! I'm a natural man...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What's goin' on?     We're late.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Come on in...!  What's that?

Speaker: room service
Dialogue: What you wanted, isn't it...a water glass with vodka...?

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: That was before...

Speaker: room service
Dialogue: Before what?

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Before you showed up...

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: I fine runnin' around in all these cute short things for you. I submissive to you. But I ain't gonna be submissive to the Brother X's and what they think. They askin' me questions alla time anyway.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What questions?!

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: I don't drink. I don't smoke. I converted to Islam for you and...

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: All except the dress! I ain't puttin' no bleached-out, double- ugly bedsheets on this body, honey! I'm normal!

Speaker: the gathered
Dialogue: Wa-Alaikum-Salaam...

Speaker: crazy man
Dialogue: Ambushed!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What? CRAZY MAN  They killed Malcolm...they shot Malcolm.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You were the first...you walked me forward, my brother...you were the first...

Speaker: sam cooke
Dialogue: "Been a long, long time comin', but a change gonna come, yes it is..."

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: meets Liston, nails him with a straight right. Ali begins baiting him, dancing. Liston tries to cut off the ring, jabbing ineffectually. Ali lets Liston in, pulls back, then pivots on his right foot, throws a short right and RAMP INTO SLO-MO...to see Liston not see it coming.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Get up, sucker! Get up and fight! No one gonna believe this!

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: It's over; it's over!

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: You okay?  What's wrong?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Why you done up like that?

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: I'm dyin' and...'cause this is how I dress! I dyin' for you out of worry...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: "Worry"...?

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Yeah. And all you care about is if I look dull enough?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: The world looks at me, girl! What if I straightened my hair, live in the white suburbs? How I am says something!

Speaker: sonji
Dialogue: Well, sorry you don't like how I am...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Where's Herbert?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What do I do...?

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: If you want, have no contact with her for ninety days. Then you make a public statement of divorce in the mosque, and Islamic law will be satisfied.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: "Satisfied?"...satisfaction is not makin' it with the woman who send you to the moon?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Please stay, Brother Herbert.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I ain't dead!

Speaker: cosmetologist
Dialogue: You got the prettiest eyes...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: He so pretty, when you look up "pretty" in the dictionary, he too pretty to be there.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What you talking about?

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Champ.   It's Eskridge...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You know about this?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...I flunk their draft board test. Now, without testing if I am "wiser" or "worser," they decide I can go into the Army.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Cassius, it is my opinion you...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: And I'm not Cassius Clay. That's a slave name. I'm a free man. I'm Muhammad Ali.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: You know, I apologize to you. On the air. Your name is Muhammad Ali. You have the right to be called whatever you want.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You make a lot of mistakes for a so-called educated man. You really go to law school?

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Yes, Muhammad. And to think I gave up a lucrative practice for the likes of you.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I'm the best thing that ever happened to you, Howard Cosell. Without me you be a tall white man with a microphone in his mouth.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: And without me...you'd be a mouth.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Have a little coffee with your sugar...?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Keep talking. You were saying something half-smart...

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: They want to make an example out of you.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Why? I'm no Stokely Carmichael, H. Rap Brown...

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: All they are is political. They tell people how they ought to be. But you are the HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION of the WORLD. You're important. And they don't like your militancy, your politics. So, they'll make an example out of you.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...of a good "Ne-gro," who do what he told?

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Yes. Or, to demonstrate here is what happens to your ass if you don't...

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: You do six weeks basic...you go into the Reserves...you don't go to Vietnam...you get to box...you even get to keep the money...

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: The Messenger would not object if you joined under these terms.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I stay out of jail and I get to fight. HERBERT  All you have to do is accept the induction. And life goes on.

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: They call your name. You say yes.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: a man
Dialogue: Federal Bureau of Investigation. Mr. Clay, you're under arrest for refusing induction...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: That's a joke, man...!

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: You know what you j-j-just said...?

Speaker: lipsyte
Dialogue: From Europe to China...every home in America...the world's gonna know what the heavyweight champion of the world said about the U.S. war...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: So what?  I ain't gonna be what anybody else want me to be. I'm not afraid to be what I want. And think how I want.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: People are following me...

Speaker: bob arum
Dialogue: I got almost nowhere I can promote a fight for you. Plus, I think they're going to vacate you from the crown.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bob arum
Dialogue: Yeah.   If you're convicted.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: They gonna take away what no fighter in the world can?

Speaker: bob arum
Dialogue: And New York may revoke your boxing license.

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: You sure you want to do all this?  Your next three to four years are every heavyweight's prime. And there are few of those years...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What 'bout Terrell?

Speaker: bob arum
Dialogue: We'll know if we can fight Terrell in Illinois this afternoon. Terrell's running his mouth. He said if you're called, you should serve...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Motherfucker. He got a deferment for bein' too tall, or havin' flat feet. Why don't he serve for me? Tellin' me what I should do...

Speaker: bob arum
Dialogue: I got to get you some fights.    Fast.

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: You understand we could take away your license to fight Terrell in Illinois?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: Are you prepared to apologize? About your unpatriotic remarks that you made?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Apologize? No.

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: You said that you were the people's champion.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yes, sir!

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: Do you think you're acting like the people's champion...?!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yes, sir. I am not going to apologize to you. This isn't a courtroom. And I don't have to sit here and answer your questions.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I ain't draft dodgin'! I ain't goin' to Canada. I ain't burnin' my draft card. I ain't burnin' the flag. I'm stayin' right here. And you want to throw me in jail? Go ahead. I'll do my time. I been in jail four hundred years. I'll be in jail four, five more. But I ain't goin' ten thousand miles to help murder and kill poor people for you. 'Cause if I'm gonna die, I'll die now, right here, fighting you. If I wanna die. You my enemy, not Vietcong or Chinese or Japanese. You my opposer when I want freedom. You my opposer when I want justice. You my opposer when I want equality. You want me to go somewhere for you, but you won't even stand up for me in America, for my rights and beliefs, you won't even stand up for me here at home.

Speaker: ernie terrell
Dialogue: Tell Clay he can get on after me.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What...?

Speaker: ernie terrell
Dialogue: Get on the scale after...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What you call me...?

Speaker: ernie terrell
Dialogue: Only thing I knows you as:   Cassius Clay!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Announce it right here or from flat on your back!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What's my name, motherfucker?!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: If the court would give me my sentence right now instead of waiting and stalling.

Speaker: judge ingraham
Dialogue: Fast enough? Your attorney will lodge an appeal. While you're out on bond, I order your passport surrendered. I'll not have you benefitting yourself by fighting abroad...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Watch now...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: See, you don't need to fight no more...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: So what's fresh, girl?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Everything fresh!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What's the freshest of the freshest?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Doughnuts just came out...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: 645 pounds. I'd still be pretty...but I be fat pretty...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: You don't remember when you met me once before...long ago...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I remember something...   Wha's your name?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: You know my name! You came to my school, right before you win the title. Interviewed you for the school paper. I was eleven.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You had a long braid...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Yeah! You called me little Indian girl, then.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: That was you?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: I loved you then, like all those kids. I never stopped. I still do.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You see the Ellis-Quarry fight?

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: Yes... We'll be in front of the U.S. Court of Appeals next month. We'll lose. Then we appeal to the Supreme Court.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Ellis the champ? Man. I beatin' on him since we was sixteen. They give Ellis to Joe Frazier? Frazier'll kill him. Then they out of juice. Where's the gate? So they gotta let me fight. I fight Ellis in a phone booth...middle of Times Square...you think that draw a crowd?

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: Draw a crowd or not draw a crowd, Muhammad, is NOT going to make a difference with your boxing licenses. They don't want you to fight.  ACLU's handling your case against the New York Boxing Commission. They discovered New York's got actual ex-murderers and ex-rapists currently licensed to fight. But revoked yours...?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Tijuana? CHAUNCEY ESKRIDGE No. State Department refused permission for the one-hour visa. No fight in Tijuana. Look...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Can't fight here. Can't fight outside the country...

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: I know people in the restaurant business...want to start up a chain. Muhammad Ali's "Champ Burger"..."Muhammad Malts," "Fist Full of Fries"...all of that.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Why I want to be in the restaurant business?!

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: 'Cause you need the money.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: How much all this gonna cost?

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: Too much.    They do that to you, too, you know.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Look out!

Speaker: customer
Dialogue: Hey, champ!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Not then...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: First time? 1961...Sister Khalilah introduced you at assembly. You said you would be heavyweight champion of the world by the time you were twenty-one!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I always tell the truth...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: I was eleven. I interviewed you for the student paper. You called me "little Indian girl," 'cause I wore my hair real long, in a braid...I told you..."Man, you scribble! You can't even write! You ought to go back to school until you do it better..."

Speaker: jimi hendrix
Dialogue: "There must be some kind of way outta here, said the joker to the thief..."

Speaker: jimi hendrix
Dialogue: "No reason to get excited, the thief, he kindly spoke. There are many here among us, who feel that life is but a joke."

Speaker: jimi hendrix
Dialogue: "But you and I, we've been through that, and this is not our fate. So let us not talk falsely now, the hour it's getting late..."

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: ...struck out at the appellate level in New Orleans. So we're heading back to the Supreme Court...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Thought we already got turned down there.

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: I'm petitioning on a conscientious objection basis. Religious belief. We'll petition that your sincere religious belief prohibits you from shooting people. I believe they'll hear that...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Where the money come from, Chauncey? Herbert tell me I'm runnin' on empty. Put aside "how do that happen"? Licenses all revoked. No passport. I can't fight here. Can't fight abroad.  And what happen if I lose the Supreme Court?

Speaker: chauncey eskridge
Dialogue: It's all over. You go to jail for five years.

Speaker: jimi hendrix
Dialogue: "Outside in the cold distance, a wild cat did growl, two riders were approaching, and the wind began to HOWL!"

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: Ellis doesn't belong in there.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Man give him a shot, he took a shot.

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: I saw Bundini in New York.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: How's he?

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: ...bad shape. You better get your belt b-b-back... Belinda brings coffee to Bingham...

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: You call your parents, Ali?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: No, he didn't. I told them about the one on the way...myself.

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: You p-p-p-promised you'd call them.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I'll call 'em, I'll call 'em...  May-may! It go in one end and come out the other.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: You wanna try changing her, for the experience?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You so much better at it, mama.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: That happen, you promise me you put some new people around you.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I need Angelo, Rudy, Ferdie --

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: Ali, she's talkin' about "Brother" Herbert.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Where are they when we need them? You got Gene Kilroy droppin' off groceries like charity. Borrowin' money from my folks. So...?

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: Norton's big and strong, but...

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Hold on one second...we have a caller. Go ahead.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Let's tell it like it is. With your court and boxing problems, Muhammad, can you get a fight promoted?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I ain't interested in the paycheck, I'd fight Joe Frazier for free in a phone booth in Times Square, if I wasn't broke. I still will.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Did you say you were broke?   How can you be broke?

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: You've made more money than all previous heavyweight champions combined. What about your management? Surely they have provided for you...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I'm saying it's time for everybody to quit lying! Muhammad Ali is the champ! I have to, I'll get the fight on myself.  And if they offer me money, I ain't gonna turn it down.

Speaker: elijah muhammad
Dialogue: Get me my son, Herbert, on the telephone!

Speaker: elijah muhammad
Dialogue: Mr. Muhammad Ali desires to do that which the Holy Qur'an teaches him against. I am, therefore, suspending Mr. Ali from the practice of Islam. He may no longer appear in temple, pray or teach, or have any conversation with any Muslim whatsoever. Furthermore...he may no longer use the name of Muhammad Ali. Henceforward, he will revert to his old slave name, Cassius Clay.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Muhammad...?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You can't call me that no more.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Hell, I can't. I'm defying them by talking to you. And being with you.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Whyn't you call an ambulance or a doctor?

Speaker: landlady
Dialogue: Wouldn't let me. Said he knew you...and to call you, Mr. Ali... He's not been out for three days...

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: Bundini!

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Watchu' doin' here? Gimme that short dog!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What's wrong with you, man?!

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Nothin' wrong with me!

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: A mystery...d-d-d-daylight...

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Leave me alone!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I leave you alone.   You called me!

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: That were a week ago...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What you shame yourself like this for, maaan...?! Why you shame yourself?!

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Lemme alone!  I'm flyin'! The Sky Chief talk through me. I know the word!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You know "low." You so low, the curb look like up!

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Yeah? The king gotta go home to his throne! From the root to the fruit...!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Those rhymes is old.    Forget 'em.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Forgive me, Muhammad.    Take me back...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: No. There's no "back" to take you to...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...you can't do what you do best in the world. And how you feed your family? From prison? Who take care of your kids? And is Allah, is God with me?

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Don't bother me. I'm a world- famous broadcaster and you're an ex-champion with diminished skills. I can't be seen you, it would be calamitous to my reputation.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Put me on, Howard. HOWARD COSELL Muhammad, I'd do anything for you. But I got bosses who only give a damn about Nielsen ratings.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I guarantee...it will be a historical and momentous night!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...what Heavyweight Champion of the World? I'm not the champ. I am retired, finished, out of the game. And I ain't gonna let myself grieve and suffer none. But I know I will not fight again...

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: I thought you were resolute in your resolve to regain your crown...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: If tomorrow they say: "We want you to fight Joe Frazier. Madison Square Garden. Millions and millionses of dollars. Here's your license back." I will tell them: "I am sorry, but I am done."

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: What about Frazier?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You'll have to wonder...what me and Smokin' Joe would have looked like.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: You surprise me, Muhammad...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Howard, you losing your hearing along with your hair? Don't put questions to it!  I am through fighting. 'Cause I got a bigger and more important match comin' up. The U.S. government. A heavier contender. HOWARD COSELL Do you think you're going to jail?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I don't know, but it's going to be a shocking and terrible fight. In fact, they might wish they let me stay in boxing.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Joe Frazier told me on this show he would knock you out.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: There you go, agitatin'.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I don't wanna fight no more.   Not with you...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Who dress you, Joe?   You look like Dale Evans.

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: Shut up.    Get in.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: To be closer to you, honey.

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: Fuck you.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: There be two undefeated heavyweight champions! And they ain't fighting!

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: I wanna fight you! Said it a hundred times. The Man won't let you fight no more. What you complainin' to me for? ALI 'Cause you gotta get behind this and we gotta do this.

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: We..."gotta" do nothin'!!!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You wanna get this on, Joe?     You and me? Or not?!

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: What about your license?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I can fight in Atlanta.

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: How's that? What about the Boxing Commission?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Georgia ain't got no state boxing commission. And Atlanta got a black city council; a liberal Jewish mayor, Sam something. It all set. I do a prelim in Atlanta with Jerry Quarry. But we got to get the steamroller movin' now.

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: What I got to do?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You announce that if I beat Quarry you give me the title shot.  So what you say...maaan?

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: My daddy was a sharecropper. I worked in a slaughterhouse...right on that corner. I came up from nothing.  What I got, I got with this. And I already got the title. So I got nothing to win and everything to lose.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: But you know you ain't the champ yet.

Speaker: frazier
Dialogue: All right. You beat Quarry, I'll get inna ring and fuck you up...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I'm fine. Thanks.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: TIME!!

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Take me back, boss.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You want me to take you back?

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: I'm clean.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You can't hit what you can't see.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: You the man! You Superman! Ain't no kryptonite in this ring tonight!

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: ...you don't need their management...

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: As-Saalam Alaikum...Brother Muhammad...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: All praise to Allah...  ...Alaikum Salaam...

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: The Messenger has lifted the suspension, Muhammad. Congratulations.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You saying I can be a Muslim again, Herbert?

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I never stopped. Like I never stopped being champ.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: I begged my father to reinstate you.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: When? After I promoted Quarry fight? After I won it?

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: We can get you Frazier.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I already got Frazier.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: We can get you five million dollars for Frazier.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Are we talking management, talking money or talking religion?

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: When you...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: When I got leery and talked up how come I'm broke, then came the suspension. Now, you explain that to me, my brother...?

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: It's my father... ALI  I love the Nation, Herbert. I love Elijah Muhammad. But it don't own me.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: My brother!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: You b-b-becoming a Christian? Forgive and forget?

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Muhammad, you T.K.O.'ed 'em...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What are you talking about, Howard? Quarry?

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: You won an 8-0 unanimous decision. You're free.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I'm free. ANGELO DUNDEE What are you talking about?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Supreme Court set me free.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: That's 'cause they know the king is gonna go home to his throne. And they know everybody's with you, now. And they wanna be on the RIGHT side!

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, fifteen rounds of boxing for the heavyweight championship of the world...

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: And in the opposite corner, the current heavyweight champion of the world, Smokin' Joe Frazier...!

Speaker: ali's eyes
Dialogue: deep in his focused concentration. His attention so arrow like it reminds us of the younger man in the Liston fight...pure purpose.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Hell of a fight, champ...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Shut up! I lost.  Get outta here...

Speaker: rudy
Dialogue: Go on!   Everybody out!

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: It was still a hell of a fight.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Where's Belinda?

Speaker: pacheco
Dialogue: She fainted... They took her to the aid station. She's okay.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: My hands was in sand, Angie.     My feet in water...

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Maybe we shoulda had more time between Blin and this, you know...to get back into...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Woulda, shoulda, coulda...  After three-and-a-half years, this...from how far back...comeback is.

Speaker: press
Dialogue: Were you robbed?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I lost. You lose, you don't shoot yourself. The world goes on.

Speaker: another reporter
Dialogue: Joe said he didn't think you wanted to fight him again...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Oh, how wrong he is.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: My God.    They killed you!

Speaker: pacheco
Dialogue: Get away from her.     What is that?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I ain't dead, baby!     C'mon.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I can move my jaw with my tongue. He got me...

Speaker: pacheco
Dialogue: It's broke. I think...I think your jaw's broke.

Speaker: pacheco
Dialogue: nods to Dundee. Dundee starts to reach. Ali snatches Angelo's hand holding the towel. Angelo's about to end the fight...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Ain't stoppin' nothin'...!  Nothin' stoppin'...!

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Now that Smokin' Joe's run out of tomato cans to beat up, I finally got Yank to commit to a rematch with you in about six months. Frazier said he'd be happy with three mil...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Foreman call me one time after he won the Olympics...

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: DOWN GOES FRAZIER! DOWN GOES FRAZIER!

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: B-b-be easy gettin' a Frazier fight now. He ain't the champ of anything except getting knocked down.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: So.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: So we only eked this one out. And George Foreman makes Frazier look like a sissy.

Speaker: pacheco
Dialogue: You see their fight?

Speaker: howard bingham
Dialogue: You mean the Joe Frazier falling- down lesson?

Speaker: pacheco
Dialogue: And Foreman is 24. You are 32 years old. I don't want to see your head get turned into someone's bull's-eye.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: ...but, you go? We're the corner, same as always. But it ain't gonna be easy.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You think I still got the tools?

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: You got the tools, Daddy.     But they different.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Well, you better sharpen 'em up. 'Cause we goin' to Africa. BUNDINI The motherland. From the root to the fruit. We gonna rumble...in the jungle.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: It's time to be heavyweight champion of the world again.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Yeah, man!

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: "Rumble in the Jungle!"     That's the name I given it.

Speaker: reporters
Dialogue: Don. Zaire? Why not Antarctica? What's wrong with New York City?

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: Because you miss the significance. I dream, as Martin Luther King once dreamt, that a man could be judged by the content of his mind. This is about black men helping black men, overcoming four hundred years of racial depression to the dawn of a new day of liberation...financial and otherwise.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Man, you crazy.

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: Ten million dollars. With one stroke of the pen, you split the world's biggest emolumation of the history of sports!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What are they saying, man?!!!    Why they saying that?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Ali, boma ye!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Fast. Six left jabs flash from his chest and shoulder, followed by a right hook and left and right uppercuts.

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: Ali, boma ye!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Ali, boma ye George Foreman!

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: You beat them, Ali!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Foreman?   I kill him!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...even if I die here. If it kill me, no matter what...I gotta win.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Howard! How many you ugly sportswriters in there got me over Foreman? Don't lie.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Some of us...Norman, me...are worried. How you gonna dance against George?? He's sparring with a middleweight, training to cut you off. He gets you against the ropes, he can knock you out with either hand.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What's the odds?

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Two-and-a-half-to-one. Against. We're worried you're going to get hurt.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: This'll be the biggest upset since Sonny Liston. I want all of you to write it down! This fight is no contest!

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Muhammad, I'm sorry. I have to ask.  Are you really fast enough, anymore? To beat George Foreman? Many people believe you don't have the same skills, that you are not the same man you used to be ten years ago.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Howard. I didn't want to talk about this, especially in front of everybody. But I talked to your wife! And she told me you're not the man you used to be...two years ago!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Salaam Alaikum, brothers!  The champ is here!

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Here's your water.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Bottled water. Frozen steaks. Brought all this stuff like Africans don't have steaks...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: You could pick up parasites...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: They eat it.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: You're seeing what you want to see, Muhammad...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Mobutu eats it...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Mobutu is taking care of Mobutu and stealing all the wealth and sending it to Switzerland...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: So? What's that do with any of why we here?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: We're here 'cause Don King got Mobutu to put up ten million dollars. Don King don't give a damn about Africa. He worse than Herbert.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Here come "Herbert."

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Yeah. 'Cause where was he when we was broke and borrowing money? And Bundini and all them that "love you"? Disappeared, is where they were.  All over you when you got it and drop off you when you don't...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Money? I do "money-making" whenever I want. Money is easy.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: And Don King fit right in...that double-breasted hipster is now a dashiki-wearing rip-off.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Don King delivered the first black- promoted championship fight in Africa!

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Don King talks black, lives white and thinks green! Why you defending him and "brother" Herbert?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: 'Cause clean-cut Muslims parading on the South Side of Chicago don't get this done! I got to put honkeys with connections and bad- ass niggers to it, too.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: And now they got you up against George Foreman. Do they give a damn you could get killed?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: That what this is? Think I gonna lose? Puttin' doubt on me?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: I think: why is my Muslim husband letting himself get strung up on a cross...? It means, "tell me."

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: I'll be back before the fight.  If that's all right, my husband...

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: Champ! Champ! George had an accident.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: Got cut. Right above his right eye. His sparring partner's elbow. Split it open, so...

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Can he fight?

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: Not for six weeks.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Are you tryin' to pull something, Don? Ali wants his title. And he wants it back in Zaire. George leaves, he ain't comin' back. George don't like it here.

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: How right you are, my suspicious and short Italian brother. And my fiduciary responsibility to this first all-black promotion is like a garden in the African sun. It must grow! It must bloom! It cannot flower in the gloom and shade of postponement to some dome. Like the Astrodome, the Super-dome, any dome outta Zaire, where it be deprived of light and bled of water. 'Cause what gonna bleed...is money. A hemorrhage of cash.  ...blood on the floor. Double hotel costs. Double travel costs. Airplanes. Food and beverage...

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: What do you expect us to do, Don?

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: Muhammad. Find a way to get George to stay. Be Moses in reverse: do NOT let my people go! Stay the fuck right here, in Egypt, if you'll pardon my Swahili.

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: L-l-l-lingala.

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: Lingala.   They s-s-s-speak Lingala.

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: Who cares?

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: If George goes? You forfeit five million. You crawl back to Cincinnati. You ain't promotin' a charity raffle...

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: If George goes? George goes, my champion, I will get you Joe Frazier. Ali-Frazier III...the fight everybody want to see. INT. PRESS CONFERENCE

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Truth is...George knocked hisself out.

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: You bad!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I'm a bad man!

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: Ain't no doubt about it.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: And you tell the same thing to George.

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: We will reschedule the fight, and to ensure George is ready, we are thinking of postponing from September 24th to October 30th.

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: What about the concert, Don? DON KING That would go off as planned on September 22nd and 23rd.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Uh-huh. I want all helicopters guarded! Private boats. Private jets. I want the airport -- I'm serious -- I want President Mobutu and all his paratroopers. Mobutu and all his paratroopers. I want all of you "Zaireans" to be on guard! Watch all strange boats tryin' to slip away! They might be takin' him out.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: The bus station. It's Ali kidding on the square. A serious point delivered not seriously to be taken seriously.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yeah. Watch the bus station. Watch everything! Elephant caravans. He might sneak out by elephant.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: What you say?

Speaker: don king
Dialogue: I ain't talkin' to you!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Hey!!!

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: What's your name?

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: Veronica Porche.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Like the sports car.

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: But with a little something extra.  Veronica, I know you now. C'mere, sit down.

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: Don brought me here, but I'm not "with"...anybody.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Where you from?

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: L.A. But my people are from Louisiana. We're Creole. So I'm African, French, Spanish, my mother's grandfather was Jewish.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Well...they all came together real nice.

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: You know...  What you think?

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: Ali, boma ye.

Speaker: plimpton type
Dialogue: ...she's an African "succubus." Means witch doctor.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Succubus? Suck my dick. They ain't room in Africa for more than one witch doctor. And that's B'dini.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You been to Hong Kong?   Taiwan? Thailand?

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I can't go there. All the ladies out there from Indonesia, Japan, Hawaii, India...  The women were so pretty...

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: 'B-b-b-bout Hong Kong, man?!   You know what I heard?

Speaker: news cameraman
Dialogue: Champ...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Let's go for a ride.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: So why you glad we still here?

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: Holdin' this in Africa make people proud. All over the world. They're proud of you. Anybody can fight in Vegas.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: That's one job.    I got two...

Speaker: veronica
Dialogue: Islamic faith help you to that?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Listen, girl, as a Muslim, I am busted out and failed in the eyes of God. I shoulda discovered Islam at 50! 'Cause I am weak on women. They take my eyes and my heart follow...causing me to be a lovin' husband and a terrible husband...!  ...okay, rest of me, let's go!!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Faster! Faster!

Speaker: dundee
Dialogue: TIME!

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: You can't lead a right hand.   Not at him!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Too long...to get it there. Man, I mean, to think you could hit him with a right lead...it's insulting... Nobody would lead a right...

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: I got him! Lock him up.

Speaker: sadler
Dialogue: Hey, hold up, chump!   Make this chump turn me loose.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Hey! Look! Look at George Foreman's trainer, feelin' me up on purpose! On the side, to see if I'm in shape!

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Can I have your autograph?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: We'll, you ain't gonna find no fat! Watch out!!

Speaker: sadler
Dialogue: Give me that thing!

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: Muhammad. Give her an Ali button!

Speaker: sadler
Dialogue: No, you ain't.  All right, give my wife an Ali button.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: She's gotta put it on.

Speaker: sadler
Dialogue: Give my wife one. BINGHAM Bo'dini, you got Ali buttons?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: "George" buttons is all I got. In my bedroom! All over the bed! Everywhere! To remind me...of all of ya'. All of ya'! Reminds me of all ya'!

Speaker: ortf interviewer
Dialogue: Pardon. Vous tes de l'ambassade des Etats-Unis? Vous avez une prdiction?

Speaker: ortf interviewer
Dialogue: Excuse me. You are from the U.S. Embassy? Do you have a prediction?

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Je suis avec l'Agence amricane d'informations. Il ne m'est pas permis d'exprimer mes prfrences entre deux citoyens des Etats-Unis.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: I'm with the U.S. Information Agency. I'm not allowed to take favorites among two United States citizens...

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: He gone?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Hello, Muhammad. Bingham.    Mr. Cosell.

Speaker: howard cosell
Dialogue: Hi...Mrs. Ali.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: When did you get in?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Just now. Muhammad, may I have a word with you, please?

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: What is going on?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You know what's going on.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: But I don't have to have it thrown in my face. I don't have to read about it and have people call me up on the phone about it...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I didn't mean for it to come out...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Oh, hell, Muhammad, you got no discretion. You never did. You humiliate me!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I know that.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Then why you got to be visible with women?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I didn't mean for it to be...

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: I live with the casual ones.  But this, this...I can't hold it together anymore. ALI I don't want to hurt you. It's wrong. You're a good wife to me.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Then why do you disrespect me this way?!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I respect you.   I always respect you.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Do you love her?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I follow my heart.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: "You're following your heart"?  And what happens now?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: I fight George.  I didn't come this far to quit.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Neither of us did.

Speaker: bingham
Dialogue: Belinda?

Speaker: mobutu
Dialogue: Invite Monsieur Idi to join me now... The Banker? The American?

Speaker: lieutenant nsakala
Dialogue: Countdown! Countdown!

Speaker: rudy
Dialogue: Countdown is on, bro.   Five minutes.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Thanks to Allah...

Speaker: lieutenant nsakala
Dialogue: Four minutes!

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Give us a moment. Alone.  Hey. This is my religion!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Where you at?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Foreman ain't no mummy. He's knocked out eight out of eleven before the end of the third round. He the most dangerous fighter I ever fought.

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: I'd worry if I was hearin' anything else.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: And I can't WAIT!

Speaker: lieutenant nsakala
Dialogue: Three minutes!

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Dance.   That's the most important...

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Forget every battle of man against man, of mind against mind, of soul against soul. This is the one. This is the greatest.

Speaker: lieutenant nsakala
Dialogue: Two minutes!

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: The prophet's come back to claim his own! Get the pretender off that throne!

Speaker: lieutenant nsakala
Dialogue: One minute!

Speaker: the people
Dialogue: Ali! Ali! Boma ye, Ali!       Ali! Boma ye!

Speaker: the people
Dialogue: Ali, boma ye! Ali, boma ye!      Ali, boma ye!

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: George is playing prima donna.   He wants to make you wait.

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: Foreman!   Foreman!   Foreman!   Foreman!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Now, both of you know the rules. When I step back, I want a good, clean break.  No hitting below the belt, no kidney punches, no...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Motherfucker, you 'bout to discover you ain't nothin'.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Ali, be quiet!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You been hearin' about me for years. All your life you been hearin' about Muhammad Ali. Now you gotta face me.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Ali, I'll disqualify you. Now, I want a good, clean, sportsman fight...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You never should have come to Africa.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Now go to your corners and come out fighting when you hear the bell, and may the best man...win...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Legs heavy...air's heavy...like sand...

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: ...keep moving. Don't let him put you into the corner. Stay off the rope!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: That all you got...?   That it?

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Get off the ropes! Get off the ropes! Get off the ropes! Dance!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...I cannot take.

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: Dance, dance!

Speaker: dundee
Dialogue: Get off the ropes!   What are you doin'?!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: George!    Show me something.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: ...been here before.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Open the door, Richard...outta this room... Put on your coat, man...get out...

Speaker: angelo dundee
Dialogue: Get off the goddamn ropes!!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Took somethin' away from him, Angie, that round...

Speaker: bundini
Dialogue: You gotta move! Stick and MOVE!

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: They don't know what's happenin'.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Take it! Terrify him with what you can take...

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Eight more rounds... You runnin' outta gas?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Now...

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Ce soir, le Zaire a t le sujet central dans le tous les centres europens. Flicitations, Monsieur le Prsident pour la vie.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Zaire was the center of the world tonight in every banking capital, all over Europe. Congratulations, President for Life.

Speaker: mobutu
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: london banker
Dialogue: What's on the menu...?

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: Maan, everything is crazy.

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: ...I didn't come this far to quit.

Speaker: ali
Dialogue: You think you got a chance, chump? Now you in trouble.
